main event: A U.S. Navy pilot flying a TBM aircraft sighted an unidentified object southeast of Mitchel AFB on 21 January 1952.
interesting points: The object was initially perceived by the pilot as a parachute due to its shape and altitude., The object maintained a consistent size and did not fade away but just vanished during the observation., The pilot experienced difficulty in confirming his ground track due to his focus on the object., The sighting lasted approximately two and a half minutes according to the pilot's estimation., The investigation suggested the object could potentially be a weather balloon released near the time of the sighting.
witness description: A U.S. Navy pilot flying a TBM aircraft
